name: Albergo Diffuso Antica Dimora del Gruccione

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Antica Dimora del Gruccione. The rooms are basic and functional, but you get a great sense of what it would be like to live in a town like Santu Lussurgiu. We've often walked the streets of these small towns wondering what the buildings look like behind all the closed doors, and this stay gave us a good sense of that.
reviews.title: Authentic Sardinian experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owners clearly care deeply about the experiences of their guests. We received a warm welcome, and appreciated their attention.
reviews.title: Charm, warm welcome, great food!
Amazing hotel,friendly staff and great food
reviews.text: But the best part of the experience, by far, was the food, which was excellent, both at dinner and at breakfast. The family is part of the Slow Food organization, and follows their philosophy of paying close attention to traditional values in preparing meals. We received a number of great Sardinian antipasti at the start of our dinner, then an excellent pasta and a main course of grilled local beef.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to others looking for an authentic Sardinian experience.
reviews.title: My favourite stay of my week in Sardinia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for one night, but we would love to go back. It was the best hotel we stayed in over the week we were in Sardinia. Our room was in the annex right at the top, with a balcony that overlooked the rooftops of the village, and beyond. The room wasn't large, but it was full of charm and even had a working fireplace with wood and matches available. The bathroom had a stand alone granite sink, hair dryer and good quality washing gels. The bed was extremely comfortable
reviews.title: Very unique hotel, amazing food
